name: Tretch v. Greater Adelphi Building and Loan Association, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Tretch v. Greater Adelphi Building & Loan Ass'n

judges: Before Kephart, C. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Tretch v. Greater Adelphi Building and Loan Association, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Drew,
In accordance with the stipulation and agreement of counsel that a similar judgment may be entered in the appeal of this case as is ordered in the case of Gorges v. Greater Adelphi Building and Loan Association, 322 Pa. 569, the judgment of the Superior Court, affirming the judgment of the Municipal Court of Philadelphia County, is reversed, and judgment is herein entered for defendant.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Drew,

attorneys: Emanuel Moss, of Moss & Moss, for appellant.
Frank, A. Simons, with him Bender & Rubin, for appellee.
Sylvan H. Hirsch, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him Herbert P. Sundheim, Special Deputy Attorney General, and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for Secretary of Banking, Amicus Curiae.
casebody.head_matter:
Tretch v. Greater Adelphi Building and Loan Association, Appellant.
Argued April 29, 1936.
Before Kephart, C. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
Emanuel Moss, of Moss & Moss, for appellant.
Frank, A. Simons, with him Bender & Rubin, for appellee.
Sylvan H. Hirsch, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him Herbert P. Sundheim, Special Deputy Attorney General, and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for Secretary of Banking, Amicus Curiae.
June 26, 1936:
